medical_history.chief_complaint: Episodic stridor and wheezing associated with feeding using a latex nipple.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant breast-fed without difficulty for her first 3 weeks. Symptoms began after switching to soy formula with a latex nipple. Stridor occurred several minutes after starting each feeding, peaked mid-feeding, and lasted until 10 minutes after feeding ended. Symptoms intensified after changes to formula, and resolution occurred shortly after arrival in the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atopy in the mother; suspected latex allergy in the infant related to feeding.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of anaphylaxis to latex.
